items.title: Pizza
items.description: A savory dish of Italian origin consisting of a usually round, flattened base of leavened wheat-based dough topped with tomatoes, cheese, and often various other ingredients.

items.title: Burger
items.description: A sandwich consisting of one or more cooked patties of ground meat, usually beef, placed inside a sliced bread roll or bun.

items.title: Sushi
items.description: A traditional Japanese dish of prepared vinegared rice, usually with some sugar and salt, accompanying a variety of ingredients, such as seafood, vegetables, and occasionally tropical fruits.

items.title: Tacos
items.description: A traditional Mexican dish consisting of a small hand-sized corn or wheat tortilla topped with a filling.

items.title: Pasta
items.description: A type of Italian food typically made from an unleavened dough of wheat flour mixed with water or eggs, and formed into sheets or other shapes, then cooked by boiling or baking.

items.title: Ramen
items.description: A Japanese dish with Chinese origins. It consists of Chinese-style wheat noodles served in a meat or fish-based broth, often flavored with soy sauce or miso, and uses toppings such as sliced pork, nori, menma, and scallions.

items.title: Paella
items.description: A Spanish rice dish originally from Valencia. It is made of white rice, green vegetables, meat, beans and seasoning such as saffron and rosemary.

items.title: Croissant
items.description: A buttery, flaky, viennoiserie pastry of Austrian origin, named for its historical crescent shape.

items.title: Curry
items.description: A variety of dishes originating in the Indian subcontinent that use a complex combination of spices or herbs, usually including ground turmeric, cumin, coriander, ginger, and fresh or dried chilies.

items.title: Steak
items.description: A meat generally sliced across the muscle fibers, potentially including a bone. It is normally grilled, though can also be pan-fried.

items.title: Dim Sum
items.description: A style of Chinese cuisine. It is prepared as small bite-sized portions of food served in small steamer baskets or on a small plate.

items.title: Falafel
items.description: A deep-fried ball or patty-shaped fritter made from ground chickpeas, fava beans, or both. It is a traditional Middle Eastern food.

items.title: Baguette
items.description: A long, thin loaf of French bread that is commonly made from basic lean dough.

items.title: Biryani
items.description: A mixed rice dish with its origins among the Indian subcontinent. It is made with Indian spices, rice, and meat, and sometimes, in addition, eggs and/or vegetables.

items.title: Fish and Chips
items.description: A hot dish consisting of fried fish in batter, served with chips. The dish originated in England.

items.title: Pad Thai
items.description: A stir-fried rice noodle dish commonly served as a street food and at most restaurants in Thailand as part of the country's cuisine.

items.title: BBQ Ribs
items.description: A type of grilled or baked pork or beef ribs, usually coated with a rich, spicy sauce.

items.title: Goulash
items.description: A stew of meat and vegetables, seasoned with paprika and other spices.

items.title: Gyro
items.description: A Greek dish made from meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie, traditionally pork, or chicken, and outside Greece with beef, veal or lamb, and usually served wrapped in a flatbread such as pita.

items.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
items.description: Chunks of roasted marinated chicken in a spiced curry sauce. The sauce is usually creamy and orange-coloured.

items.title: Peking Duck
items.description: A dish from Beijing that has been prepared since the imperial era. The meat is characterized by its thin, crisp skin, with authentic versions of the dish serving mostly the skin and little meat.

items.title: Hamburger
items.description: A sandwich consisting of one or more cooked patties of ground meat, usually beef, placed inside a sliced bread roll or bun.

items.title: Lasagna
items.description: An Italian dish made of stacked layers of thin flat pasta alternating with fillings such as ragù and other vegetables, cheese, and seasonings and spices such as garlic, oregano and basil.

items.title: Sashimi
items.description: A Japanese delicacy consisting of fresh raw fish or meat sliced into thin pieces and often eaten with soy sauce.

items.title: Fish Taco
items.description: A taco filled with grilled or fried fish, lettuce or cabbage, pico de gallo, and a sour cream or citrus/mayonnaise sauce, all encased in a corn or flour tortilla.

items.title: Lobster Roll
items.description: A sandwich native to New England, filled with lobster meat served on a grilled hot dog-style bun with the opening on the top rather than the side.

items.title: Ceviche
items.description: A South American seafood dish that originated in Peru, made from fresh raw fish cured in citrus juices and spiced with chili peppers, onions, and cilantro.

items.title: Chicken Parmesan
items.description: A dish that consists of breaded chicken breast covered in tomato sauce and mozzarella, parmesan, or provolone cheese.

items.title: Moussaka
items.description: An eggplant- (aubergine) or potato-based dish, often including ground meat, in the cuisines of the countries of the Eastern Mediterranean.

items.title: Poutine
items.description: A dish of french fries and cheese curds topped with a brown gravy. It emerged in Quebec, Canada, in the late 1950s in the Centre-du-Québec area.

items.title: Pho
items.description: A Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat, sometimes chicken.

items.title: Baklava
items.description: A layered pastry dessert made of filo pastry, filled with chopped nuts, and sweetened with syrup or honey.

items.title: Beef Bourguignon
items.description: A stew made of beef braised in red wine, often red Burgundy, and beef broth, generally flavoured with carrots, onions, and garlic, and garnished with pearl onions, mushrooms, and bacon.

items.title: Bratwurst
items.description: A type of German sausage made from pork, beef, or veal.

items.title: Creme Brulee
items.description: A dessert consisting of a rich custard base topped with a texturally contrasting layer of hardened caramelized sugar.

items.title: Gumbo
items.description: A stew popular in the U.S. state of Louisiana, and is the official state cuisine. Gumbo consists primarily of a strongly-flavored stock, meat or shellfish, a thickener, and the Cajun holy trinity of vegetables, namely celery, bell peppers, and onions.

items.title: Hot Dog
items.description: A grilled or steamed food consisting of a sausage served in the slit of a partially sliced bun. It can also refer to the sausage itself.

items.title: Jambalaya
items.description: A dish of West African, French, and Spanish influence, consisting mainly of meat and vegetables mixed with rice. Traditionally, the meat always includes sausage of some sort, often a smoked meat such as andouille.

items.title: Kebab
items.description: Various cooked meat dishes with their origins in Middle Eastern cuisine. Many variants are popular around the world.

items.title: Kimchi
items.description: A staple in Korean cuisine, is a traditional side dish of salted and fermented vegetables, such as napa cabbage and Korean radish, made with a widely varying selection of seasonings.

items.title: Macarons
items.description: A sweet meringue-based confection made with egg white, icing sugar, granulated sugar, almond meal, and food colouring.

items.title: Nachos
items.description: A Mexican dish from northern Mexico that consists of heated tortilla chips or totopos covered with melted cheese, often served as a snack.

items.title: Oysters
items.description: A number of different families of salt-water bivalve molluscs that live in marine or brackish habitats. In some species, the valves are highly calcified, and many are somewhat irregular in shape.

items.title: Pancakes
items.description: A flat cake, often thin and round, prepared from a starch-based batter that may contain eggs, milk and butter and cooked on a hot surface such as a griddle or frying pan, often frying with oil or butter.

items.title: Quesadillas
items.description: A Mexican dish and type of taco, consisting of a tortilla that is filled primarily with cheese, and sometimes meats and spices, and then cooked on a griddle.

items.title: Ratatouille
items.description: A French Provençal stewed vegetable dish, originating in Nice, and sometimes referred to as ratatouille niçoise.

items.title: Shawarma
items.description: A dish in Middle Eastern cuisine consisting of meat cut into thin slices, stacked in a cone-like shape, and roasted on a slowly-turning vertical rotisserie or spit.

items.title: Tiramisu
items.description: A coffee-flavoured Italian dessert. It is made of ladyfingers dipped in coffee, layered with a whipped mixture of eggs, sugar, and mascarpone cheese, flavoured with cocoa.

items.title: Udon
items.description: A type of thick, wheat-flour noodle used frequently in Japanese cuisine.

items.title: Vanilla Ice Cream
items.description: A wide variety of frozen foods, from ice on a stick to a mixture of ingredients such as cream, sugar, and flavorings.
